title: Simulation/VR-Based University Science Teaching Method Design (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific domain theories and understanding of experimental procedures
context.additional_context: Conducting project-based assessments in a digital device-provided environment for office/administrative professionals

learning_goals: Learners can explain the scientific experiment design and analysis process using simulation/VR tools
Learners apply experimental problem-solving strategies with over 80% accuracy through peer feedback and instructor coaching

Within 4 weeks, learners will analyze science experiment data (e.g., physics simulations, virtual chemical reactions) collected in VR environments and write a 10-page project report applying ≥3 scientific principles (e.g., Newton’s laws of motion, chemical reaction rates). In a 10-minute presentation, they must achieve "Excellent" grades in ≥4 of 5 evaluation rubric criteria: clarity, logic, creativity, accuracy, and visual effectiveness.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
